question.text: The malarial parasites initially multiply within the liver cells and then attack the red blood cells (RBCs) resulting in their rupture. The rupture of RBCs is associated with release of

options.text: A toxic substance, hypnotoxin, (responsible for chill and high fever) recurring every 6-7 days.
A toxic substance, hypnotoxin, (responsible for chill and high fever) recurring every 3-4 days.
A toxic substance, hemozoin, (responsible for chill and high fever) recurring every 6-7 days.
A toxic substance, hemozoin, (responsible for chill and high fever) recurring every 3-4 days.

solution.text:
The life cycle of Plasmodium - It requires two hosts to complete its life cycle - Human (host) and female Anopheles mosquito (vector).

A. Female Anopheles mosquito bites the human and releases sporozoites in the blood.

B. Multiplication of parasites in the liver cells.

C. The entry of parasite into RBCs → Rupture of RBCs → Release of a toxic substance → Hemozoin → Hemozoin causes chills and high fever repeating every 3 to 4 days.

D. Female Anopheles mosquito bites an infected person → Parasites enter the mosquito's body (gut) and undergo further development.

E. Multiplication of parasites within the body of mosquito to form sporozoites → Sporozoites are stored in the salivary glands.

F. Step A - E repeated.
